intro: Peltaea krapovickasiorum, commonly known as the Krapovickas' peltate, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its unique peltate leaves, which are broad and shield-shaped with a central point. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually green or yellowish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
